      • lightScrub

        public java.lang.Boolean lightScrub()
        checking entrys in database against real world to find discrepancies. In this context, light means entrys and existence of objects are checked, not the binary data.
        Returns:
        if one failure occurs, then function returns false. you can use zombie_versions to determine which

      • zombie_versions

        public java.util.Collection<FileVersion> zombie_versions()
        find all versions of this application and checks its registered storagecells for existence
        Returns:

      • recover

        public java.lang.Boolean recover(FileVersion _version)
        checks locations for given version and tries to get it from one location to recover it at failed locations.
        Parameters:
        _version - typical from zombie_versions()
        Returns:
        full success, one failure turns to false
